message.content:
Here's a regular expression that should work for extracting a three character code from a filename in the format "57-1Jn.usfm":
```css
^[A-Za-z0-9]{3}\.(usfm)$
```
This regular expression matches any string that starts with exactly three characters, which can be upper or lower case letters or digits. The `^` and `$` anchors ensure that the entire string is matched, not just a substring of it. The `\.` character specifies that the dot character must appear at the end of the string, and the `usfm` at the end of the pattern ensures that the filename extension is ".usfm".
